poem:
### Morning Headline

The news sits heavy with the rising sun,  
young ones caught in the whirl of modern life—  
crafted meals and chemicals by the tongue,  
their fate curls in a teacup, dense with strife.  
A childhood, touched by time's uneasy dance,  
finds youth beneath the specter's sharpened knife.  
Whispers of fate, linger in their chance.
